Crawford/West:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Crawford/West | image = | caption = | image_size = | alias = | origin = United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1997–1998 | label = [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] | past_members = Rick Crawford
Kenny West }} '''Crawford/West''' was an American country music duo consisting of Rick Crawford (from [[Texas]]) and Kenny West (from [[Arkansas]]).[http://www.allbusiness.com/retail-trade/miscellaneous-retail-retail-stores-not/4628761-1.html Country | Entertainment & Arts > Music Industry from AllBusiness.com] Signed to [[Warner Bros. Records]], they released their first single, "Summertime Girls," in May 1997.[{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r338580|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( Summertime Girls > Overview )))] The song peaked at No. 75 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart in the United States and No. 91 on the ''[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]'' Country Tracks chart in Canada. A second single, "Healing End," was released in June 1998, but failed to chart.[{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r439797|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( Healing End [CD5/Cassette Single] > Overview )))] Two months later, the duo requested to be released from their recording contract with Warner Bros.[http://www.allbusiness.com/services/amusement-recreation-services/4576445-1.html Talent Traffic | Trends & Events > Arts Festivals & Exhibitions from AllBusiness.com] ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
